pullrequest.title: DRC Finals Demo: Add blocks for 3rd task and change shortkeys

content.raw: I think this sentence might be slightly confusing. In the Towers of Hanoi game, you are allowed to stack disks "out of order" as you are solving the puzzle, as long as a smaller disk is always on top of a larger disk. For example, if disk 0 is the largest disk, disk 1 is smaller and disk 2 is the smallest, you can stack disk 2 on disk 0, even though the order is 2-1-0.
content.html: I think this sentence might be slightly confusing. In the Towers of Hanoi game, you are allowed to stack disks "out of order" as you are solving the puzzle, as long as a smaller disk is always on top of a larger disk. For example, if disk 0 is the largest disk, disk 1 is smaller and disk 2 is the smallest, you can stack disk 2 on disk 0, even though the order is 2-1-0.
